full_summary:
# W0117-230018: Boreoscope Endoscope Procurement 

## Government Tender Announcement
#### Description
The Department of National Defence (DND) has issued a Request for Proposal for the procurement of one (1) portable handheld borescope endoscope to support preventive and corrective maintenance on the CT-142 Dash 8 aircraft.

#### Key Objectives
* The contractor must supply and deliver a minimum of one portable handheld borescope endoscope

#### Contract Period
The expected start date of the contract is 2024-03-01, and deliverables must be received by 29 March 2024.

#### Additional Requirements
* The contractor must provide a minimum of one day training for system operation and maintenance within one week of delivery and installation
* The contractor must provide a minimum of 1/2 day training on software within one week of delivery and installation

#### Marketing Criteria
The procurement process follows the principles of competitive open bidding. The selection criteria is based on the lowest price.

#### Solicitation Details  
Offerors are required to submit their responses by 14:00 EST on February 9, 2024. Consult the [procurement notice](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18503436?extsite=MTg1MDM0MzZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==) for further information.

#### Contracting Entity etc.
The contracting department is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), based in Gatineau, Quebec, Canada. The end user is the Department of National Defence (DND), with its main office located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

You can contact the contracting department for any enquiries:
* Lorraine Jenkinson, PSPC  
	+ Email: [lorraine.jenkinson@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:lorraine.jenkinson@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)  
	+ Telephone: Nil    
* Note: All communication will be in accordance with the rules agreed upon during the contractual agreement. 

The Notice of Amendment outlines modifications to the submission deadlines. Accordingly, we invite interested companies to submit their bids by the stipulated deadline. 

Note that the requirement is under the  Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) Framework Agreement, the Canadian government tends to allow bidders from both domestic and international establishments. 

Frozen portion 
The Manitoba or Alberta region shall be the place of delivery of the requested items.
